headline: Google & Amazon join Trump admin's AI-powered 'Genesis mission'
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Thursday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Amazon (AMZN), Google (GOOG, GOOGL), Nvidia (NVDA), Palantir (PLTR), and other companies are partnering with the Trump administration on its new "Genesis mission." Lululemon (LULU) is facing activist investor pressure from Elliott Investment Management, which recently took a $1 billion stake in the retailer. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Google & Amazon join Trump admin's AI-powered 'Genesis mission'
content.description:
Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Thursday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute.

Amazon (AMZN), Google (GOOG, GOOGL), Nvidia (NVDA), Palantir (PLTR), and other companies are partnering with the Trump administration on its new "Genesis mission."

Lululemon (LULU) is facing activist investor pressure from Elliott Investment Management, which recently took a $1 billion stake in the retailer.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Elliott pushes for former Ralph Lauren exec. as new Lululemon CEO
summary: As Lululemon (LULU) searches for a new CEO, Elliott Management has taken a $1 billion stake in the athleisure company. The activist investor is pushing for Jane Nielsen, a former Ralph Lauren (RL) executive, to be considered, sources told Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma, alongside Slatestone Wealth chief market strategist Kenny Polcari, joins Opening Bid to talk about the CEO shake-up. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma, alongside Slatestone Wealth chief market strategist Kenny Polcari, joins Opening Bid to talk about the CEO shake-up.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Elliott Said to Build a $1 Billion-Plus Stake in Lululemon
summary: Elliott has been working for months with retail executive Jane Nielsen — a former chief financial officer and chief operating officer at Ralph Lauren — on Lululemon, said the person, who asked to remain unnamed as the matter is private.  The Wall Street Journal, which first reported on the news, said Nielsen is viewed by the activist as a potential CEO candidate.

content.title: Elliott Said to Build a $1 Billion-Plus Stake in Lululemon
content.summary: Elliott has been working for months with retail executive Jane Nielsen — a former chief financial officer and chief operating officer at Ralph Lauren — on Lululemon, said the person, who asked to remain unnamed as the matter is private.  The Wall Street Journal, which first reported on the news, said Nielsen is viewed by the activist as a potential CEO candidate.

headline: lululemon to Expand International Presence in 2026 with Stores to Open in Six New Markets
summary: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, December 18, 2025--lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) today announced plans to expand its international presence in 2026 with six new market entries – a record number for the brand in a single year – through its new franchise partnership model agreements. lululemon plans to launch in Greece, Austria, Poland, Hungary, and Romania next year with partner Arion Retail Group, in addition to its previously announced entry into India through a partnership with Tata CLiQ.

content.title: lululemon to Expand International Presence in 2026 with Stores to Open in Six New Markets
content.summary: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, December 18, 2025--lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) today announced plans to expand its international presence in 2026 with six new market entries – a record number for the brand in a single year – through its new franchise partnership model agreements. lululemon plans to launch in Greece, Austria, Poland, Hungary, and Romania next year with partner Arion Retail Group, in addition to its previously announced entry into India through a partnership with Tata CLiQ.

headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From Lululemon’s Q3 Earnings Call
summary: Lululemon’s third quarter was met with a strong positive market reaction, reflecting investor confidence in its underlying business trends. Management attributed the outperformance to robust international growth, particularly in China, where revenue climbed sharply. CEO Calvin McDonald highlighted the company’s continued success in broadening its product pipeline and expanding its global footprint, stating, “We have broadened our global reach from 18 to over 30 geographies and grown the company'

headline: Is Lululemon’s Rebounding Share Price Now Aligned With Its Fundamentals in 2025?
summary: Wondering if lululemon athletica is finally trading at a price that makes sense, or if the market is still misreading the story? Let us break down whether today’s share price stacks up against the company’s fundamentals. The stock has bounced sharply in the short term, climbing 10.8% over the last week and 26.6% over the past month, even though it is still down around 44.2% year to date and 44.1% over the last year. Recently, investors have been digesting headlines around shifting consumer...
